title: How should one start a speech on human rights? - Quora

response.answer_text: You don’t want to start with a joke because this is damn serious stuff, but something about the life of Malala is appropriate, even light hearted, and perhaps a quote. Malala Yousafzai Quotes (Author of I Am Malala) Provide some history on a broader scale over the last 150 or so years. Then you are set up to talk about what human rights are, and what we can do to improve them around the world. Use some example from about four countries that offenders of human rights. Include both successes and failures. Talk about what went wrong with the failures and how did the successes happen. Aim the talk to your audience and take into consideration what they are there to listen to you to hear. Challenge them to do their part in helping human rights but don’t demand anything. End with the quote from another advocate for human rights that you admire.
